snippet: A Saudi-led aerial campaign against the Houthis, a rebel militia movement, has become so broad and vicious that critics accuse the coalition of collectively punishing people living in areas the Houthis control.
abstract: Airstrikes conducted by Saudi-led military coalition have become deadliest threat faced by Yemenis, especially in northern regions of country; growing civilian death toll raises concerns over tactics of coalition, which rarely acknowledges such killings, and solidifies anger toward Saudi Arabia and allies, including United States.

byline.contributor: Shuaib Almosawa contributed reporting from Hajja, Yemen, and Eric Schmitt from San Francisco.

lead_paragraph: A Saudi-led aerial campaign against the Houthis, a rebel militia movement, has become so broad and vicious that critics accuse the coalition of collectively punishing people living in areas the Houthis control.

headline.main: Airstrikes Take Toll on Civilians in Yemen War
headline.print_headline: Airstrikes Take Toll on Civilians in Yemen War
